body:
I was expecting this to fail to compile somewhere, maybe in the CI, but that doesn't seem to be the case? 
Seems workable given the SSP related changes in the newer mingw-w64 headers (which are in Guix):
> Implement some of the stack protector functions/variables so -lssp is now optional when _FORTIFY_SOURCE or -fstack-protector-strong is used.

However I think this would still be broken in some older environments, so we might have to wait for a compiler bump, or similar. The optional -lssp also seems to work when using older headers, which doesn't make sense.

Guix build (aarch64)
```bash
e7c156cfd9c203beba7e23b38442114f3f694e50c5e22be0f301127848313083  guix-build-b12c66e674dd/output/dist-archive/bitcoin-b12c66e674dd.tar.gz
bd4fe452474cb9e053d3ebe3dfc7611eae2df220e93e16e785fe5a21113a0bbb  guix-build-b12c66e674dd/output/x86_64-w64-mingw32/SHA256SUMS.part
d88360508b60a6d6bd9f032f7129200c2a2e185ebfe78197f9ff87e76792977e  guix-build-b12c66e674dd/output/x86_64-w64-mingw32/bitcoin-b12c66e674dd-win64-debug.zip
baa1349d93e6a5653efdf5084547857f4d27ba8a9a2835f1d251a66420253b0d  guix-build-b12c66e674dd/output/x86_64-w64-mingw32/bitcoin-b12c66e674dd-win64-setup-unsigned.exe
ac78a623b69e93b7df78fc48464fab7fa9f6aa3bf0f0912b31cd2ba90417232b  guix-build-b12c66e674dd/output/x86_64-w64-mingw32/bitcoin-b12c66e674dd-win64-unsigned.tar.gz
849de39e3168e65026c38efa63a374d6e938aad3a94c3036f02d6eb95ce951f8  guix-build-b12c66e674dd/output/x86_64-w64-mingw32/bitcoin-b12c66e674dd-win64.zip
```

Would fix #28104.
title: build: Windows SSP roundup
